page.title: 03THE IRONBRIDGE
page.content: The Ironbridge contains nearly 400 tons of castings. It was cast at the Coalbrookdale works and erected by late summer 1779. In 1775 the estimate for building the bridge had been Â£550. The total cost was much greater, Â£2,737. The bridge was the first iron bridge in the world, it quickly became a tourist attraction. On May 5 1985, during the Ironbridge Gorge Museum Trust plastic duck race, the Ironbridge was damaged. People crowded on the bridge that day. The police realised the danger and tried to clear the bridge. After the duck race, rivets and bolts were found underneath the bridge. In the future, to protect the Ironbridge, the police are trying to keep the numbers on the bridge down to 200 at large events.
